content.title: Fibromuscular Dysplasia of the Renal Artery
content.summary: Renal artery fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD) is a non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory vascular disease affecting the renal arteries, most commonly presenting as renovascular hypertension in young women. The medial fibroplasia subtype creates the classic 'string of beads' appearance on angiography.
content.definition: A non-atherosclerotic angiopathy affecting the renal arteries characterized by abnormal cell growth and fibrous tissue in arterial wall layers, leading to stenosis, aneurysm, or dissection

epidemiology.prevalence: 3-5% of potential kidney donors (higher than clinically recognized)
epidemiology.multivessel: 25-50% have FMD in other arterial beds (carotid, vertebral)

medial_fibroplasia.pathology: Alternating areas of thick fibromuscular ridges and thin media
medial_fibroplasia.angiography: 'String of beads' - beads larger than artery diameter
medial_fibroplasia.location: Mid to distal renal artery, often bilateral

intimal_fibroplasia.pathology: Circumferential or eccentric intimal collagen deposition

duplex.criteria: Peak systolic velocity >200 cm/s suggests stenosis

medical_therapy.role: Adequate for mild hypertension, initial therapy

technique.stenting: Generally avoided unless dissection or recoil

follow_up.imaging: CTA or MRA annually initially, then every 2-3 years if stable

content.statement: Fibromuscular Dysplasia of the Renal Artery is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Genetic-Connective-Tissue Fibromuscular-Dysplasia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Fibromuscular Dysplasia of the Renal Artery helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Fibromuscular Dysplasia of the Renal Artery include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Fibromuscular Dysplasia of the Renal Artery.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity

definition.@value: Non-atherosclerotic angiopathy of the renal arteries causing renovascular hypertension, primarily in young women

learning_objectives: Describe the epidemiology and histologic classification of renal FMD
Recognize the classic 'string of beads' angiographic appearance
Outline the diagnostic workup for suspected renal FMD
Compare medical and interventional management options
Identify the role of screening for multivessel FMD
clinical_pearls: Young hypertensive woman with bruit = think renal FMD
'String of beads' = medial fibroplasia (most common type)
Balloon angioplasty preferred; stenting generally avoided
Screen for carotid/intracranial FMD (25-50% have multivessel)

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Fibromuscular Dysplasia of the Renal Artery. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
